text.0: loving the loving one as wives their husband the sisters of one home have urged him forward.
text.1: brightcoloured even as the cows love morning dark breaking forth to view and redly beaming.
text.2: our sires with lauds burst een the firmset fortress yea the aṅgirases with roar the mountain.
text.3: they made for us a way to reach high heaven they found us day light days sign beams of morning.
text.4: they stablished order made his service fruitful then parting them among the longing faithful.
text.5: not thirsting after aught they come most active while with sweet food the race of gods they strengthen.
text.6: since mātariśvan fardiffused hath stirred him and he in every house grown bright and noble.
text.7: he bhṛgulike i hath gone as his companion as on commission to a greater sovran.
text.8: when man poured juice to heaven the mighty father he knew and freed himself from close embracement.
text.9: the archer boldly shot at him his arrow and the god threw his splendour on his daughter.
text.10: whoso hath flames for thee within his dwelling or brings the worship which thou lovest daily.
text.11: do thou of double might increase his substance may he whom thou incitest meet with riches.
text.12: all sacrificial viands wait on agni as the seven mighty rivers seek the ocean.
text.13: not by our brethren was our food discovered find with the gods care for us thou who knowest.
text.14: when light hath filled the lord of men for increase straight from the heaven descends the limpid moisture.
text.15: agni hath brought to light and filled with spirit the youthful host blameless and well providing.
text.16: he who like thought goes swiftly on his journey the sun alone is ever lord of riches.
text.17: the kings with fair hands varuṇa and mitra protect the precious nectar in our cattle.
text.18: o agni break not our ancestral friendship sage as thou art endowed with deepest knowledge.
text.19: old age like gathering cloud impairs the body before that evil be come nigh protect me.
